#Text=Makeni
#Text=Makeni is a city in Sierra Leone .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Makeni is the main provincial town in the North of Sierra Leone .
#Text=It has seen rapid development in the last few years because of its proximity to the major mining and bio-fuel production areas .
#Text=Get in
#Text=The roads from Freetown are very good .
#Text=From Freetown , head to Masiaka , Rogbere Junction and then via Lunsar to Makeni .
#Text=The journey from Freetown should take less than 2 hours , depending on the traffic conditions in Freetown .
#Text=The road to Magburaka is also in good condition .
#Text=Eat
#Text=There are several very nice places to eat in Makeni .
#Text=Global Restaurant on Magburaka Road offers both local and international food for a very good price .
#Text=The waitresses are extremely friendly and appreciate the business and will often sit and chat with you throughout your visit .
#Text=If you 're looking for a more familiar touch , you must go to The Clubhouse Bar , also on Magburaka Road .
#Text=This is a bar and restaurant operated by the charity Street Child of Sierra Leone .
#Text=All profits are used for Street Child projects across the country .
#Text=Whilst prices are expensive in comparison to other restaurants around Makeni , the food is very good and it is one of the few air conditioned buildings in Makeni .
#Text=At the Clubhouse you have the choice of sitting outside under one of two large awnings in the courtyard , or sit inside in the main area of the restaurant .

#Text=Most of the time , it is quiet enough that you will have full control over the television and AC , meaning that you can watch the news during your lunch or take in a football match with your friends .
#Text=It also has become a popular hangout area for young volunteers from abroad , so there is usually a very good vibe around the place .
#Text=In the centre of town , near the Clock Tower , there are several food stalls offering all kinds of food .
#Text=Popular choices are the bread and meat skewer stations .
#Text=You can buy a loaf of bread and 5 skewers of meat for about Le 6,000 , or under £1 , and make a delicious meat sandwich which will fill you up for hours .
#Text=There are also several fruit stalls offering seasonal produce throughout the day and night .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Makeni has a few hotels/guest houses which are above the general standard expected for a regional town .
#Text=The most famous of which is the Wusum Hotel .
#Text=A substantial sum was invested in the construction of this place and it is popular with international visitors .
#Text=MJ 's Hotel is also of a reasonable standard and is on the main road through Makeni .
#Text=There are some other guest houses in and around the town .
#Text=Wusum Hotel , 64 Teko Road Makeni , ☏ +232-76-341079 .
#Text=A new high standard hotel ( some say the best in Sierra Leone ) .

#Text=There is a good pool , air conditioned rooms , full electricity 24/7 , gymming facilities , games area&bar ( table tennis , snooker & pool ) , sports bar&night club ( showing premier league games ) and wireless Internet .
#Text=US$ 105 .
#Text=MJ 's Hotel .
#Text=Reasonable and affordable accommodation .
#Text=Power during the night 1900-0700 , but air conditioning only runs from 2100-0200.
#Text=TV in each room with DSTV and cold showers .
#Text=Connect
#Text=Western style commercial radio station , Capital Radio , covers the city on 103.3MHz .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Makeni is a good base for exploring the Northern Province .
#Text=It is easy to get transport to Kamakwie , the town nearest to Outamba-Kilimi National Park .
